Key Match Events: Germany dominated long periods and created many chances but failed to make the breakthrough against a resilient Ukraine.
Ukraine's back line held firm in a fine demonstration of defence, led a string of top saves by goalkeeper Anatolii Trubin.
Maximilian Beier rattled the inside of the post with a first-time shot from Andrich's perfect through ball.
Pre-Game Insights: Germany's head coach Julian Nagelsmann talks to Germany's goalkeeper #01 Manuel Neuer during the friendly football match Germany v Ukraine, in Nuremberg, eastern Germany, on June 3, 2024.
Nagelsmann was without Real Madrid's Toni Kroos and Antonio Ruediger, both rested after winning the Champions League final as well as Borussia Dortmund pair Nico Schlotterbeck and Niclas Fuellkrug.
Germany came into this game having turned a corner under Nagelsmann, winning their last two games against France and the Netherlands with an aggressive, high tempo style.
Post-Match Reflections: Nagelsmann told German public broadcaster Das Erste that he had the impression that the team wanted to win and they played very well for long stretches.
Nagelsmann was quoted saying that the first 20 minutes of the game were very, very good. We had to take the lead then.
Nagelsmann said that they need to be even more aggressive, get more players into the box and put a bit more stress on the visitors' penalty area.
Miscellaneous Highlights: More than 44,000 fans were in jovial mood at kick-off, expecting a Germany that have rediscovered their form under Julian Nagelsmann put on a show less than two weeks before they start Euro 2024 against Scotland in Munich on June 14.

The Ukrainians, who qualified for their fourth straight Euro with a play-off victory over Iceland in March, will be buoyed by denying the tournament hosts on home soil as they look to come through a group that also includes Romania, Slovakia and Belgium.
